intro: Mecodium contiguum, commonly known as the clustered mecodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is occasionally grown in gardens and botanical collections.
